member.name: M:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.Form.ShowDialog(Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.Form)

summary.para: Shows a the form as a dialog.

The ShowDialog in Visual WebGui works differently than WinForms. Code lines after this call is executed immediately and won’t wait for the dialog to close. If you need to run code only after the dialog is closed or only if a specific result is returned register to the close event of the dialog.
See documentation for code example.

example.para: The following code example displays a form as a modal dialog box and evaluates the return value of the dialog box before determining whether to show a message box or not.
example.code: Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click Dim objForm1 As New Form1() AddHandler objForm1.Closed, AddressOf objForm1_Closed objForm1.ShowDialog(Me) End Sub Private Sub objForm1_Closed(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EventArgs) If DirectCast(sender, Form1).DialogResult = DialogResult.OK Then MessageBox.Show("Dialog result OK") End If End Sub

member.param: Obj window.

member.summary: Displays the control to the user.

member.summary: Shows a the form as a dialog.

summary.para: Shows a form as a dialog.

The ShowDialog in Visual WebGui works differently than WinForms. Code lines after this call is executed immediately and won’t wait for the dialog to close. If you need to run code only after the dialog is closed or only if a specific result is returned register to the close event of the dialog.
See code example.

example.para: The following code example displays a form as a modal dialog box and evaluates the return value of the dialog box before determining whether to show a message box or not.
example.code: Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click Dim objForm1 As New Form1() AddHandler objForm1.Closed, AddressOf objForm1_Closed objForm1.ShowDialog() End Sub Private Sub objForm1_Closed(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EventArgs) If DirectCast(sender, Form1).DialogResult = DialogResult.OK Then MessageBox.Show("Dialog result OK") End If End Sub

member.name: M:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.HtmlBox.ProcessGatewayRequest(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String)
member.summary: Provides a way to handle gateway requests.
member.param: The gateway request HTTP context.
The gateway request action.
member.returns: By default this method returns a instance of a class which implements the IGatewayHandler and throws a non implemented HttpException.
member.remarks: This method is called from the implementation of IGatewayComponent which replaces the IGatewayControl interface. The IGatewayCompoenent is implemented by default in the RegisteredComponent class which is the base class of most of the Visual WebGui components. Referencing a RegisterComponent that overrides this method is done the same way that a control implementing IGatewayControl, which is by using the GatewayReference class.

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.SplitContainer
member.summary: Represents a control consisting of a movable bar that divides a container's display area into two resizable panels.
member.remarks: You can add controls to the two resizable panels, and you can add other SplitContainer controls to existing SplitContainer panels to create many resizable display areas. Use the SplitContainer control to divide the display area of a container (such as a Form) and allow the user to resize controls that are added to the SplitContainer panels. When the user passes the mouse pointer over the splitter, the cursor changes to indicate that the controls inside the SplitContainer control can be resized.

member.summary: Retrieves a for the display that contains the largest portion of the specified control.
member.returns: A for the display that contains the largest region of the specified control. In multiple display environments where no display contains the control, the display closest to the specified control is returned.
member.param: A for which to retrieve a .

member.summary: Retrieves a for the display that contains the largest portion of the object referred to by the specified handle.

member.param: The window handle for which to retrieve the .

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.FontDialog.AllowScriptChange
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can change the character set specified in the Script combo box to display a character set other than the one currently displayed.
member.returns: true if the user can change the character set specified in the Script combo box; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.FontDialog.AllowSimulations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box allows graphics device interface (GDI) font simulations.
member.returns: true if font simulations are allowed; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.FontDialog.AllowVectorFonts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box allows vector font selections.
member.returns: true if vector fonts are allowed; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.FontDialog.AllowVerticalFonts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays both vertical and horizontal fonts or only horizontal fonts.
member.returns: true if both vertical and horizontal fonts are allowed; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.FontDialog.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected font color.
member.returns: The color of the selected font. The default value is .

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.FontDialog.FixedPitchOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box allows only the selection of fixed-pitch fonts.
member.returns: true if only fixed-pitch fonts can be selected; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the selected font.
member.returns: The selected font.

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.FontDialog.FontMustExist
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box specifies an error condition if the user attempts to select a font or style that does not exist.
member.returns: true if the dialog box specifies an error condition when the user tries to select a font or style that does not exist; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum point size a user can select.
member.returns: The maximum point size a user can select. The default is 0.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum point size a user can select.
member.returns: The minimum point size a user can select. The default is 0.

member.summary: Gets values to initialize the .
member.returns: A bitwise combination of internal values that initializes the .

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.FontDialog.ScriptsOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box allows selection of fonts for all non-OEM and Symbol character sets, as well as the ANSI character set.
member.returns: true if selection of fonts for all non-OEM and Symbol character sets, as well as the ANSI character set, is allowed; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.returns: true if the dialog box contains an Apply button; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts
member.summary: Represents the state of a data-bound control when a data error occurred.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.ClipboardContent
member.summary: A data error occurred when copying content to the Clipboard. This value indicates that the cell value could not be converted to a string.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.Commit
member.summary: A data error occurred when committing changes to the data store. This value indicates that data entered in a cell could not be committed to the underlying data store.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.CurrentCellChange
member.summary: A data error occurred when the selection cursor moved to another cell. This value indicates that a user selected a cell when the previously selected cell had an error condition.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.Display
member.summary: A data error occurred when displaying a cell that was populated by a data source. This value indicates that the value from the data source cannot be displayed by the cell, or a mapping that translates the value from the data source to the cell is missing.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.Formatting
member.summary: A data error occurred when trying to format data that is either being sent to a data store, or being loaded from a data store. This value indicates that a change to a cell failed to format correctly. Either the new cell value needs to be corrected or the cell's formatting needs to change.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.InitialValueRestoration
member.summary: A data error occurred when restoring a cell to its previous value. This value indicates that a cell tried to cancel an edit and the rollback to the initial value failed. This can occur if the cell formatting changed so that it is incompatible with the initial value.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.LeaveControl
member.summary: A data error occurred when the lost focus. This value indicates that the could not commit user changes after losing focus.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.Parsing
member.summary: A data error occurred when parsing new data. This value indicates that the could not parse new data that was entered by the user or loaded from the underlying data store.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.PreferredSize
member.summary: A data error occurred when calculating the preferred size of a cell. This value indicates that the failed to calculate the preferred width or height of a cell when programmatically resizing a column or row. This can occur if the cell failed to format its value.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.RowDeletion
member.summary: A data error occurred when deleting a row. This value indicates that the underlying data store threw an exception when a data-bound deleted a row.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts.Scroll
member.summary: A data error occurred when scrolling a new region into view. This value indicates that a cell with data errors scrolled into view programmatically or with the scroll bar.

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle
member.summary: Specifies constants indicating when the error icon, supplied by an , should blink to alert the user that an error has occurred.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle.AlwaysBlink
member.summary: Always blink when the error icon is first displayed, or when a error description string is set for the control and the error icon is already displayed.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle.BlinkIfDifferentError
member.summary: Blinks when the icon is already displayed and a new error string is set for the control.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle.NeverBlink
member.summary: Never blink the error icon.

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment
member.summary: Specifies constants indicating the locations that an error icon can appear in relation to the control with an error.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment.BottomLeft
member.summary: The icon appears aligned with the bottom of the control and the left of the control.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment.BottomRight
member.summary: The icon appears aligned with the bottom of the control and the right of the control.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment.MiddleLeft
member.summary: The icon appears aligned with the middle of the control and the left of the control.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment.MiddleRight
member.summary: The icon appears aligned with the middle of the control and the right of the control.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment.TopLeft
member.summary: The icon appears aligned with the top of the control and to the left of the control.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment.TopRight
member.summary: The icon appears aligned with the top of the control and to the right of the control.

summary.para: AspControlBoxBase provides a base class for creating ASP.NET wrapped controls that can be integrated into VWG as a native control.
The class provides services for ASP.NET – VWG communication and using ASP.NET markup code to initialize the ASP.NET control.

para.font: The following example illustrates the basic use of AspControlBoxBase.

example.code:
<SYSTEM.COMPONENTMODEL.TOOLBOXITEM(TRUE)> _ Partial Class MyWrappedWebControl Inherits Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.Hosts.AspControlBoxBase
''' <SUMMARY> ''' Get the hosted control type ''' </SUMMARY> Protected Overrides Readonly Property HostedControlType() As System.Type Get Return GetType(System.Web.UI.Control) End Get End Property
''' <SUMMARY> ''' Get hosted control typed instance ''' </SUMMARY> Protected Readonly Property HostedControl As WebControl Get Return CType(Me.HostedControl, WebControl) End Get End Property
End Class

member.name: M:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.Hosts.AspControlBoxBase.ProcessGatewayRequest(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String)
member.summary: Provides a way to handle gateway requests.
member.param: The gateway request HTTP context.
The gateway request action.
member.returns: By default this method returns a instance of a class which implements the IGatewayHandler and throws a non implemented HttpException.
member.remarks: This method is called from the implementation of IGatewayComponent which replaces the IGatewayControl interface. The IGatewayCompoenent is implemented by default in the RegisteredComponent class which is the base class of most of the Visual WebGui components. Referencing a RegisterComponent that overrides this method is done the same way that a control implementing IGatewayControl, which is by using the GatewayReference class.

member.summary: Displays a message box that can contain text, buttons, and symbols that inform and instruct the user.

member.name: M:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.MessageBox.Show(System.String)

summary.para: Displays a message box with specified text.

The Show MessageBox in Visual WebGui works differently than WinForms. Code lines after this call are executed immediately and won’t wait for the dialog to close. If you need to run code only after the dialog is closed or only if a specific result is returned use Show(string strText,EventHandler objEventHandler).

member.returns: One of the values.
member.param: The text to display in the message box.

member.name: M:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.MessageBox.Show(System.String,System.EventHandler)

summary.para: Displays a message box with specified text.

The Show MessageBox in Visual WebGui works differently than WinForms. Code lines after this call are executed immediately and won’t wait for the dialog to close. If you need to run code only after the dialog is closed or only if a specific result is returned place that code in the EventHandler function that will run once the dialog is closed.

member.returns: One of the values.

example.code:
Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click MessageBox.Show("My message", AddressOf objMessageBox_Closed) End Sub
Private Sub objMessageBox_Closed(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Closed If DirectCast(sender, MessageBoxWindow).DialogResult = DialogResult.OK Then MessageBox.Show("Message Box OK") End If
End Sub

member.param: The text to display in the message box.
An function.

The Show MessageBox in Visual WebGui works differently than WinForms. Code lines after this call are executed immediately and won’t wait for the dialog to close. If you need to run code only after the dialog is closed or only if a specific result is returned place that code in the EventHandler function that will run once the dialog is closed.

member.returns: One of the values.
member.exception: The buttons parameter specified is not a member of .-or- The icon parameter specified is not a member of .
An attempt was made to display the in a process that is not running in User Interactive mode. This is specified by the property.

example.code:
Private Sub button1_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EventArgs) MessageBox.Show("My message", "My message caption", MessageBoxButtons.OK, MessageBoxIcon.Information, AddressOf objMessageBox_Closed) End Sub
Private Sub objMessageBox_Closed(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Closed If DirectCast(sender, MessageBoxWindow).DialogResult = DialogResult.OK Then MessageBox.Show("Message Box OK") End If
End Sub

member.param: The text to display in the message box.
The text to display in the title bar of the message box.
One of the values that specifies which buttons to display in the message box.
One of the values that specifies which icon to display in the message box.
An function.

member.summary: Tab control client behavior modes

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.TabControlClientBehavior.MemoryOptimized
member.summary: TabControl draws only on tab at a time. This mode is optimized for large tab page content displaying in DHTML. When loading lots of controls or data intensive controls in multiple tabs, this mode avoids browser from having to deal with large amount of dom elements.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.TabControlClientBehavior.DrawingOptimized
member.summary: TabControl does not redraw its tabs when switching between tabs. This mode is optimized for resonable tab page content and provides an advantage for working with browser navigation inside the tab pages.

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.Hosts.FlashBox
member.summary: Flash box control can host Flash movies and embed them in a Visual WebGui application.

example.code: Dim objFlashBox As New FlashBox() objFlashBox.Movie = "../../../../../Resources/Flash/FC_2_3_Column3D.swf" objFlashBox.AddParameter("FlashVars", "&dataURL=../../../../../Resources/Flash/FC_2_3_Column3D.xml") objFlashBox.AddParameter("quality", "high") objFlashBox.Dock = DockStyle.Fill Me.Controls.Add(objFlashBox)

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.Extenders.UniqueIdExtender

summary.para: UniqueIdExtender adds the ability to sets a unique id to a control.
Since Visual WebGui optimizes its requests we can not lean on the internal ids of components specified by the server.
By uniquely identifying anchor components, we ensure that those Ids will be sent back from the server at any response so that we would be able to lean on ids in order to create valuable replays.

requirements.para: You nee to add a using/import to Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.Extenders to the form

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlUpdateMode
member.summary: Determines when changes to a data source value get propagated to the corresponding data-bound control property.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlUpdateMode.OnPropertyChanged
member.summary: The bound control is updated when the data source value changes, or the data source position changes.

summary.summary: Specifies the style and behavior of a control.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.AllPaintingInWmPaint
member.summary: If true, the control ignores the window message WM_ERASEBKGND to reduce flicker. This style should only be applied if the bit is set to true.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.CacheText
member.summary: If true, the control keeps a copy of the text rather than getting it from the each time it is needed. This style defaults to false. This behavior improves performance, but makes it difficult to keep the text synchronized.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.ContainerControl
member.summary: If true, the control is a container-like control.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.DoubleBuffer
member.summary: If true, drawing is performed in a buffer, and after it completes, the result is output to the screen. Double-buffering prevents flicker caused by the redrawing of the control. If you set to true, you should alsoset and to true.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.EnableNotifyMessage
member.summary: If true, the method is called for every message sent to the control's . This style defaults to false. does not work in partial trust.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.FixedHeight
member.summary: If true, the control has a fixed height when auto-scaled. For example, if a layout operation attempts to rescale the control to accommodate a new , the control's remains unchanged.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.FixedWidth
member.summary: If true, the control has a fixed width when auto-scaled. For example, if a layout operation attempts to rescale the control to accommodate a new , the control's remains unchanged.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.Opaque
member.summary: If true, the control is drawn opaque and the background is not painted.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.OptimizedDoubleBuffer
member.summary: If true, the control is first drawn to a buffer rather than directly to the screen, which can reduce flicker. If you set this property to true, you should also set the to true.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.ResizeRedraw
member.summary: If true, the control is redrawn when it is resized.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.Selectable
member.summary: If true, the control can receive focus.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.StandardClick
member.summary: If true, the control implements the standard behavior.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.StandardDoubleClick
member.summary: If true, the control implements the standard behavior. This style is ignored if the bit is not set to true.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.SupportsTransparentBackColor
member.summary: If true, the control accepts a with an alpha component of less than 255 to simulate transparency. Transparency will be simulated only if the bit is set to true and the parent control is derived from .

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.UserMouse
member.summary: If true, the control does its own mouse processing, and mouse events are not handled by the operating system.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.UserPaint
member.summary: If true, the control paints itself rather than the operating system doing so. If false, the event is not raised. This style only applies to classes derived from .

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ControlStyles.UseTextForAccessibility
member.summary: Specifies that the value of the control's Text property, if set, determines the control's default Active Accessibility name and shortcut key.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.TextFormatFlags.NoPrefix
member.summary: Turns off processing of prefix characters. Typically, the ampersand (&) mnemonic-prefix character is interpreted as a directive to underscore the character that follows, and the double-ampersand (&&) mnemonic-prefix characters as a directive to print a single ampersand. By specifying , this processing is turned off. For example, an input string of "A&bc&&d" with applied would result in output of "A&bc&&d".

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.TextFormatFlags.PathEllipsis
member.summary: Removes the center of trimmed lines and replaces it with an ellipsis.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.TextFormatFlags.PrefixOnly
member.summary: Applies to Windows 2000 or Windows XP only:

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ValidationConstraints
member.summary: Defines constants that inform about how it should validate a container's child controls.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ValidationConstraints.Enabled
member.summary: Validates child controls whose property is set to true.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ValidationConstraints.ImmediateChildren
member.summary: Validates child controls that are directly hosted within the container. Does not validate any of the children of these children. For example, if you have a that contains a custom , and the contains a , using will cause the event of the to occur, but not the event of the .

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ValidationConstraints.None
member.summary: Validates all child controls, and all children of these child controls, regardless of their property settings.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ValidationConstraints.Selectable
member.summary: Validates child controls that can be selected.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ValidationConstraints.TabStop
member.summary: Validates child controls that have a value set, which means that the user can navigate to the control using the TAB key.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.ValidationConstraints.Visible
member.summary: Validates child controls whose property is set to true.

member.name: T:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.AutoValidate
member.summary: Determines how a control validates its data when it loses user input focus.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.AutoValidate.Disable
member.summary: Implicit validation will not occur. Setting this value will not interfere with explicit calls to or .

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.AutoValidate.EnableAllowFocusChange
member.summary: Implicit validation occurs, but if validation fails, focus will still change to the new control. If validation fails, the event will not fire.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.AutoValidate.EnablePreventFocusChange
member.summary: Implicit validation occurs when the control loses focus.

member.name: F:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.AutoValidate.Inherit
member.summary: The control inherits its behavior from its container (such as a form or another control). If there is no container control, it defaults to .

member.name: P:Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.MaskedTextBox.PromptChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to represent the absence of user input in .
member.returns: The character used to prompt the user for input. The default is an underscore (_).
member.exception: The prompt character specified is the same as the current password character, . The two are required to be different.
The character specified when setting this property is not a valid prompt character, as determined by the method of the class.
